subject: Productivity
title: The Invention of the Weekend
description: A fast breakdown of The Invention of the Weekend for builders.

hook.text: In 1908, a New England mill gave workers Saturday off to keep Jewish employees happy.

buildup.text: Before weekends, six-day work weeks were standard. Rest days varied by religion and region.

discovery.text: Henry Ford popularized the two-day weekend in 1926. He believed rest boosted Monday productivity.

twist.text: Ford's motive wasn't kindness. He wanted workers to have time to buy and use his cars.

climax.text: The weekend became law in most countries by the mid-1900s, reshaping how billions live.

punchline.text: The weekend was invented to sell more cars.

quiz.question: Why did Henry Ford popularize the two-day weekend?
options: He believed rest boosted productivity and consumer spending
Workers went on a nationwide strike
